articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: Former Hibernian captain, David Gray, stepped-in as interim manager each of the last four years, before finally being appointed to the position ‘permanently’ yesterday.  Following Celtic’s success by recruiting Australian Ange Postecoglou, a year ago Hibs appointed Nick Montgomery, who had just won the A-League as manager of Central Coast Mariners. Montgomery was a successful [...]
articles.title: Most Dysfunctional Club title

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: JOE McBRIDE was Jock Stein’s first signing for Celtic at £22,000 from Motherwell in the summer of 1965. The powerhouse and prolific hitman walloped in 86 goals in 94 appearances for his boyhood idols in his three years at Parkhead. An astonishing 54 of the strikes came in only 55 league games. Today in Part Two, [...]
articles.title: A BHOY CALLED JOE: Part Two

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: THE irrepressible Bertie Auld hit the headlines when Celtic played their first game since conquering Europe in Lisbon on May 25 1967. Unfortunately, for the midfield master it was for all the WRONG reasons. Bertie, who sadly passed away in November 2021 at the age of 83, told his friend and author Alex Gordon all [...]
articles.title: OLE AND ADIOS: WEE BERTIE SEES RED IN MADRID

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: ‘DONDE esta, Johnstone?’ Alfredo di Stefano was clearly perplexed. ‘Donde est, Johnstone?’ he repeated, raising the decibel level slightly. The iconic Real Madrid forward, once rated by Pele as ‘the most complete footballer in the history of the game’, was in a bit of a tizzy. Di Stefano had assembled a spectacular line-up of legends [...]
articles.title: 57 YEARS AGO: THE NIGHT WEE JINKY STOLE DI STEFANO’S THUNDER

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC were on the receiving end of back-to-back Premiership defeats, enjoyed their first Champions League win in a decade and completed the year with the cheers of 60,000 joyous fans ringing round Parkhead following a success over Philippe Clement’s ‘rejuvenated Rangers’. Brendan Rodgers’ side eased into December with Premiership victories over St Johnstone (3-1) and Hibs [...]
articles.title: DIARY OF AN EPIC SEASON: DECEMBER

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS replaced Norwegian Ronny Deila in the summer of 2016 to kick off Celtic’s unbeatable and unstoppable silverware crusade. The Irishman followed in the footsteps of Jock Stein and Martin O’Neill as a Hoops manager to lead the club to total domination of Scottish football. CQN has journeyed back in time to turn the spotlight [...]
articles.title: THREE CHEERS: TREBLE No.4 (2016/17)

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: ONE-TIME Celtic wonderkid Islam Feruz quit football at the age of 24 in April 2020 – to set up his own clothing brand. The forward, once tipped to go all the way to the top by former manager and mentor Tommy Burns, walked out on the Hoops at the age of 16 to join Chelsea. [...]
articles.title: WHATEVER HAPPENED TO…ISLAM FERUZ?

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: The Premier League in England will today vote on a Wolves proposal to ditch Video Assisted Referees.  Wolves endured several poor VAR decisions in the season just ended which has raised their dander.  Celtic suffered from terrible VAR decisions, especially when it was new in 2022.  Those early experiences anchored some of our thinking. Without [...]
articles.title: VAR’s crucial role in tight league and cup race

articles.description: JOE McBRIDE made his Celtic debut when he lined up for his boyhood idols in a League Cup group game against Dundee at Parkhead on Saturday August 21 1965. The man who had never hidden his admiration of the Hoops eventually got his great wish to lead the team. Unfortunately, after returning from injury sustained [...]
articles.title: A BHOY CALLED JOE: Part One

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC’S erratic form in November was perfectly illustrated in two games five days apart. Brendan Rodgers’ 10-man side – with Daizen Maeda red-carded early in proceedings – crashed 6-0 to Atletico Madrid in the Spanish capital as their Champions League hopes were obliterated. The Hoops reversed the 6-0 scoreline when Aberdeen were the visitors to Parkhead [...]

It didn’t augur well when Boerrigter [...]

articles.description: I have no axe to grind with Manchester City, we have enjoyed a profitable association with them over many years, but you and I are still triggered by powerful clubs working in the dark spaces around the edge of league rules. This month they face an arbitration meeting over their dispute with the Premier League, [...]

articles.description: JAMES FORREST is now rubbing shoulders with Celtic legends Jimmy Quinn and Patsy Gallacher after extending his goalscoring sequence to FIFTEEN successive seasons.
